question: With reference to the political parties of 1920s, who among the following have been referred as “No Changers” ?
option3: Those who wished to contest in elections
option4: Those who accepted the Montague-Chelmsford Reforms
explanation: There was once more a split in Indian National Congress in 1922 and those who believed in Non-cooperation Movement of Mahatma Gandhi and followed him were called No changers.
